page.title: 01Glenbranter Forest&Loch Eck
page.content: Steep sided hills rise on either side of Loch Eck to an altitude of approximately 600 metres. On the west side of Loch Eck, there are some precipitous rocky faces. On either side of the Loch, there are extensive plantations of mature conifers, mainly spruce with some larch. There are also areas of natural woodland such as oak and birch. Extensive areas of forest have been felled and replanted. On the east side of the loch, ground above the tree line is used for sheep grazing. The trunk road from Dunoon to Strachur follows the Lochside. There is a small hotel called the "The Whistlefield Hotel"
